response_parsed.title: Observing Stream Processing in FastAPI using Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to implement real-time stream processing using FastAPI and Python 3.12+'s async IO improvements, leveraging the AsyncIterator and aiohttp for handling WebSockets.
key_points: FastAPI enables building APIs with ease and flexibility, including WebSocket support.
Python 3.12+ includes improved async IO performance that is crucial for stream processing.
Utilize aiohttp to handle WebSocket connections and messages in an asynchronous manner.
Leverage AsyncIterators to manage the data stream from clients efficiently.

code_examples.code:
```python
from fastapi import FastAPI, WebSocket
import asyncio
import aiohttp

app = FastAPI()

socket = app.websocket('/ws')

socket_connections = set()

async def broadcast(message):
    for sock in socket_connections:
        await sock.send_text(message)

async def websocket_connect(websocket: WebSocket):
    global socket_connections
    socket_connections.add(websocket)
    await websocket.accept()
    
    async for msg in websocket:
        await broadcast(msg) 

socket.on('/ws').connect(websocket_connect)
app.run()
```

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for the improved async IO performance.
FastAPI version should be >=0.65.0 to support WebSocket features.
caveats: Ensure your server and client can handle real-time stream processing, as it may require additional resources.
